font.strong: Based on the Governor's order, all schools are closed until at least May 15.

span.strong: To assist families during the closure, we have compiled the following resources:

span.span: Emails to Families:Â Â Copies are located here: Emails to Families

u.strong: How to Update Your Email Address in the IC Parent Portal:

span.span: Frequently Asked Questions: Click here for FAQs while we are closed. Updated
Laptop Distribution:Â Please complete a Technology Request Form if you need a laptop. Limit one per family.

p.font: Password and Technology Support: Information and the technology support request form is here: Technology Support

span.span: Home Education Resources: Educational resources for families have been posted here: Educational Resources

Meal Distribution: The District isÂ providing pre-packaged meals to families with children under 18 who need them, from 9 am to 11:30 am Monday through Thursday, with double meals provided on Thursdays (for Thursday and Friday).Â Â Drive-thru pick is availableÂ at the loading dock at Penfield High School (behind the school - follow the signs). Please stay in your vehicle; food service employees will hand you the meals when you drive up.Â If you need meals and cannot make it to the high school, please contact the food service office at 249-6483.

Mental Health Resources:Â Please call our Safe School Helpline at 1-800-418-6423, ext. 359 and follow the prompts. We also have a full list of community mental health resources on our website at: Mental Health ResourcesÂ
Community Health Resources: Providers to assist with alcohol and drug abuse, physical abuse and mental health needs: Community Health Resources

Parent Resources:
What Kids Want to Know About Coronavirus
State Education Department Talking About COVID-19 and Mental Health Resources.
Ten Ways for Adults to Take Ten
Prevention:
The CDC continues to emphasize the following measures to prevent the spread of viruses, including COVID-19:

Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds (the length of the âHappy Birthdayâ song twice). If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.Â
Cover your cough or sneeze with your sleeve or a tissue (then throw the tissue in the trash).
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick and seek assistance from your doctor if you experience symptoms that cause concern.
Wear a mask or face covering when in public places and continue to practice social distancing.
Additional Resources:
Parents can stay up to date on the most recent COVID-19 developments through the following local, state and federal health agencies:
Monroe County Health Departmentâs website:Â
New York State Novel Coronavirus Hotline at (888) 364-3065 and website:Â
The CDC website:Â

td.span: pdf file: You need Adobe Acrobat Reader (version 7 or higher) to view this file. Download the free Adobe Acrobat Reader for PC or Macintosh.

div.p: This website is maintained by the Director of Communications and the Director of Technology according to the web publishing guidelines of the Penfield Central School District. If you are unable to access any aspect of our site, please email our district webmaster so that we may provide you with alternative means of access or use. The Website Accessibility Guidelines page contains additional information regarding accessibility.
